meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.longTitle: An Ordinance to provide for the designation of the Kai Tak Cruise Terminal, for its use, operation, management and control, and for related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Kai Tak Cruise Terminal Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員), in relation to a provision of this Ordinance, means—(a)a public officer, or a member of a class of public officers, authorized under section 6(1) in relation to that provision;(b)a public officer, or a member of a class of public officers, authorized under section 6(1) in relation to this Ordinance generally; or(c)a police officer on duty within the Terminal Area;
Commissioner (專員) means the Commissioner for Tourism;

cruise ship (郵輪) means—(a)a vessel—(i)carrying or intended to be used to carry passengers exclusively for sightseeing or pleasure purposes; and(ii)plying, along a predetermined route, on any voyage—(A)from a port outside Hong Kong to the same or another port outside Hong Kong, during the course of which Hong Kong is an intermediate port of call; or(B)which begins, ends or begins and ends within the waters of Hong Kong, whether or not the vessel calls at any port outside Hong Kong during its course; or(b)a vessel approved as such under section 23;
functions (職能) includes powers, duties and activities;

law enforcement officer (執法人員) means—(a)a police officer;(b)a member of the Immigration Service established by section 3 of the Immigration Service Ordinance (Cap. 331); or(c)a person holding an office specified in Schedule 1 to the Customs and Excise Service Ordinance (Cap. 342);
non-permanent restricted area (非永久限制區) means an area designated as such under section 9(1)(a)(ii);
owner (擁有人) means a person within the meaning of paragraph (a) of the definition of owner in section 2 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313);
pass (通行證) means a pass issued under Schedule 2;
permanent restricted area (永久限制區) means an area designated as such under section 9(1)(a)(i);
property manager (管理者) means a person who enters into a contract with the Government for providing property management services in relation to any part of the Terminal Area specified in the contract;

restricted area (限制區) means an area comprising one or more of the following—(a)a permanent restricted area;(b)a non-permanent restricted area (except any non-permanent restricted area, or part of it, declared under section 10(1) to cease to be a restricted area for the time being);

tenancy agreement (租賃協議) means an agreement—(a)between—(i)the Government as the landlord; and(ii)any person as the tenant; and(b)for the operation and management of the Terminal in relation to any part of the Terminal Area specified in the agreement;
Terminal (郵輪碼頭) means the Kai Tak Cruise Terminal designated under section 3;
Terminal Area (郵輪碼頭區) means the area described in Schedule 1;
terminal operator (碼頭營運者) means a person who enters into a tenancy agreement as the tenant with the Government;
vehicle (車輛) means any vehicle whether or not mechanically propelled;
vessel (船隻) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Designation of Terminal
section.content: The Terminal Area is designated as a terminal, to be known as the “Kai Tak Cruise Terminal”.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Use of Terminal
section.leadIn: The Terminal is to be used—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the berthing or anchorage of cruise ships;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for facilitating the embarkation and disembarkation of passengers of cruise ships;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for carrying out any activity that the Commissioner considers appropriate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for ancillary purposes.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may operate and manage the Terminal on a commercial basis.

Subject to the tenancy agreement between the Government and a terminal operator, the operator may operate and manage the Terminal in relation to any part of the Terminal Area specified in the agreement on a commercial basis.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1) or (2), for the purposes of operating and managing the Terminal on a commercial basis under that subsection, the Commissioner or a terminal operator may determine, demand and collect any or all of the following fees and rents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fees for the berthing or anchorage of cruise ships or other vessels;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rents for the lease or sublease of any premises;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fees for licences for the entry, use or occupation of any premises;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fees for the use of vehicle parking facilities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other fees.

subsection.leadIn: The fees and rents referred to in subsection (3) are not limited by reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in operating and managing the Terminal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the recovery of expenditure in operating and managing the Terminal.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, subject to the tenancy agreement between the Government and a terminal operator, any moneys received by the operator in the course of operating and managing the Terminal in accordance with the agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are not moneys raised or received for the purposes of the Government under section 3 of the Public Finance Ordinance (Cap. 2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be retained by the operator.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may authorize a public officer, or any member of a class of public officers, to be an authorized officer for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An authorization under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be given in relation to specified provisions of this Ordinance or in relation to this Ordinance generally.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), the Commissioner may, in writing, delegate any of his or her functions under this Ordinance to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public officer or any member of a class of public officers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a terminal operator; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a property manager.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may not delegate under subsection (3) his or her function under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1) or (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 9(1); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 24(1).

subsection.content: If a function is delegated to a terminal operator or property manager (delegate) under subsection (3), the delegate may sub-delegate that function to the delegate’s employee.

subsection.leadIn: If a function under this Ordinance is performed by a person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a terminal operator or an employee of a terminal operator; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a property manager or an employee of a property manager,

subsection.continued: then, until the contrary is proved, the person is taken to have performed the function in accordance with an authorization or delegation under this section.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance (other than in subsections (1) and (3) and sections 9(1) and 24(1)), a reference to the Commissioner in relation to a function includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person to whom the function is delegated by the Commissioner under subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person sub-delegates that function to the person’s employee under subsection (5), that employee.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Access by persons to and from Terminal Area and order to leave

subsection.leadIn: A person must not enter or leave the Terminal Area except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by an entrance or exit of the Terminal Area specified by the Commissioner or an authorized officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by means of a vessel.

subsection.content: If the Commissioner or an authorized officer considers it necessary for the operation, safety or security of the Terminal, the Commissioner or officer may order a person to leave the Terminal Area, or any part of it.

If the Commissioner or an authorized officer considers it necessary for the operation, safety or security of the Terminal, the Commissioner or officer may, by notice or sign exhibited in a conspicuous place within or near the Terminal Area, prohibit access by any person or class of persons to the Terminal Area, or any part of it.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with an order given under subsection (2) or a notice or sign exhibited under subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Vehicles and vessels within, entering, leaving Terminal Area etc.

subsection.content: A person must not drive a vehicle into or out of the Terminal Area except by an entrance or exit of the Terminal Area specified by the Commissioner or an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the permission of the Commissioner or an authorized officer, a person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: navigate a vessel into, within or out of the Terminal Area; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause an object to float on, or be in, the sea within the Terminal Area.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the navigation of a vessel that is used by a person acting in his or her capacity as a public officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the navigation of a vessel that is scheduled to be berthed or anchored within the Terminal Area; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the use of a life-saving appliance in an emergency.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner or an authorized officer considers it necessary for the operation, safety or security of the Terminal, the Commissioner or officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a direction or an order to the driver of a vehicle or the owner or master of a vessel (including an order requiring the vehicle or vessel to leave the Terminal Area, or any part of it); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exhibit a notice or sign in a conspicuous place within or near the Terminal Area for vehicles or vessels.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (4)(b), the Commissioner or an authorized officer may exhibit a notice or sign under that subsection to prohibit access by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any vehicle or class of vehicles; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any vessel or class of vessels,

subsection.continued: to the Terminal Area, or any part of it.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

If the driver of a vehicle or the owner or master of a vessel, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction or an order given, or a notice or sign exhibited, under subsection (4) while the vehicle or vessel is within, entering or leaving the Terminal Area, the driver, owner or master commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: designate an area of land or water within the Terminal Area as—

subparagraph.content: a permanent restricted area; or
a non-permanent restricted area; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vary or revoke the designation of a permanent restricted area or non-permanent restricted area.

subsection.content: A notice published under subsection (1) for the purposes of designating, or varying the boundaries of, a permanent restricted area or non-permanent restricted area must describe and delineate the area by reference to a plan.

subsection.leadIn: A plan under subsection (2) must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: numbered, dated and signed by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deposited in the Commissioner’s office.

subsection.content: A designation, variation or revocation under subsection (1) becomes effective on the date the notice is published in the Gazette or a later date specified in the notice.
A notice under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may declare by notice that a non-permanent restricted area, or any part of it, specified in the notice ceases to be a restricted area during the period specified in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to cater for operational needs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to facilitate the use of the non-permanent restricted area, or that part of it, for carrying out any activity that the Commissioner considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The notice under subsection (1), or its copy, must be exhibited in a conspicuous place within or near the non-permanent restricted area, or the part of it, concerned during the period of cessation.
A notice under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Demarcation of restricted areas
section.content: The Commissioner must cause the boundaries of, or entrances to, a restricted area to be demarcated by signs, or in any other manner, that will reasonably indicate the restricted area to members of the public who might enter it.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Prohibition of entry etc. to restricted areas

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 14(1), a person must not enter or remain in a restricted area unless—

subparagraph.content: is in possession of a valid pass issued for the restricted area; and
produces the pass for examination on entering the restricted area, and at any time while present in the restricted area if so required by the Commissioner or an authorized officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is being escorted by the Commissioner, or an authorized officer, who is in possession of a valid pass issued for the restricted area; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person is a law enforcement officer on duty within the Terminal Area.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not enter or leave a restricted area except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by an entrance or exit of the restricted area specified by the Commissioner or an authorized officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by means of a vessel.

subsection.content: A person must not remain in a restricted area, or any part of it, after being ordered to leave the restricted area, or that part of it, by the Commissioner or an authorized officer.

Except with the permission of the Commissioner or an authorized officer, a person (other than a law enforcement officer on duty within the Terminal Area) must not drive a vehicle into a restricted area.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Passes
section.content: Schedule 2 has effect with respect to a pass.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Exemption for bona fide passengers and crew members

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a bona fide passenger or a bona fide crew member of a vessel scheduled to be berthed or anchored within the Terminal Area is exempted from section 12(1) if the passenger or crew member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is passing through any restricted area—

subparagraph.content: after having disembarked from the vessel; or
for boarding the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is on board the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: A passenger or crew member of a vessel is not exempted under subsection (1) unless the passenger or crew member is in possession of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a valid travel document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a valid document issued by the owner or master of the vessel for identifying the passengers or crew members of the vessel.

subsection.content: The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a restricted area, or any part of it, if the Commissioner or an authorized officer has, by notice or sign exhibited in a conspicuous place within or near the restricted area, prohibited access by passengers and crew members of vessels to the restricted area, or that part of it.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the permission of the Commissioner or an authorized officer, a person must not board, or disembark from, a vessel within the Terminal Area—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: while the vessel is in motion; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise than by a gangway.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner or an authorized officer may give an order, or exhibit a notice in a conspicuous place within the Terminal Area, to prohibit any person from doing any of the following within the Terminal Area—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: selling anything;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offering anything for sale, or offering any service;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: displaying or exhibiting any material for the purpose of advertisement or publicity (except where it is displayed or exhibited inside, or on the body of, a vehicle);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: distributing any material;

subparagraph.content: by radio or television; or
by video or cinematographic film.

subsection.leadIn: The prohibition under subsection (1) does not affect the performance of a function—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a person acting in his or her capacity as a public officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person who is an employee of the Hong Kong Tourism Board acting in the course of that employment.

subsection.content: The prohibition under subsection (1) does not apply in relation to anything done on board a vessel.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with an order given, or a notice exhibited, under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Hong Kong Tourism Board (香港旅遊發展局) means the body of that name established by section 3(1) of the Hong Kong Tourism Board Ordinance (Cap. 302);
material (資料) means any printed, electronic, written or pictorial matter or any article, including any book, leaflet, banner and sample.

subsection.content: A person must not cause any danger, nuisance or annoyance to another person within the Terminal Area.

The Commissioner or an authorized officer may prohibit a person from entering, or order a person to leave, the Terminal Area, or any part of it, if, in his or her reasonable opinion, the person has caused, is causing or will probably cause disturbance to the operation of the Terminal.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner or an authorized officer may prohibit a person from entering, or order a person to leave, the Terminal Area, or any part of it, if, in his or her reasonable opinion, the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is under the influence of alcohol, medicine or drug; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a probable danger or source of nuisance or annoyance to another person within the Terminal Area.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a prohibition or an order imposed on the person under subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.
To avoid doubt, subsection (2) or (3) does not limit section 7(2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: Except with the permission of the Commissioner or an authorized officer or with lawful authority, a person must not interfere with, meddle with or move in any way—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any equipment or machine owned by the Government, a terminal operator or a property manager within the Terminal Area; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or data stored in such equipment or machine.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the permission of the Commissioner or an authorized officer or with lawful authority, a person must not activate any emergency or safety device within the Terminal Area unless the activation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose for which the device is provided; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with any instructions shown on the device.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

If the Commissioner or an authorized officer considers it necessary for the operation, safety or security of the Terminal, the Commissioner or officer may give a reasonable direction or order to any person.

If the Commissioner or an authorized officer considers it necessary for the operation, safety or security of the Terminal, the Commissioner or officer may exhibit a notice or sign in a conspicuous place within the Terminal Area.

If a person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction or an order given under subsection (1), or a notice or sign exhibited under subsection (2), while the person is within the Terminal Area, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not, while within the Terminal Area—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: throw, deposit, leave or drop litter or rubbish (other than in a bin or container provided for the purpose);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: throw, deposit, leave or drop anything capable of causing injury to a person or damage to property;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: open, remove or climb over any wall, fence, railing, barrier, gate or post constructed or erected within the Terminal Area;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, set out or leave anything which obstructs, inconveniences or endangers, or may obstruct, inconvenience or endanger, another person or any vehicle or vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: loiter in the Terminal Area with intent to commit an arrestable offence;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: beg;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: fish; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: smoke or carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to anything done on board a vessel.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

If the Commissioner or an authorized officer has reasonable grounds for suspecting that a person has committed an offence under this Ordinance, the Commissioner or officer may, without warrant and if necessary by using reasonable force, detain the person.

subsection.leadIn: If a person is detained under subsection (1) by the Commissioner or by an authorized officer who is not a law enforcement officer, then the Commissioner or officer must, to the extent practicable, forthwith after detaining the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: take the person to a police station to be dealt with in accordance with the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deliver the person into the custody of a police officer to be dealt with in accordance with that Ordinance.

subsection.content: If a person is detained under subsection (1) by an authorized officer who is a law enforcement officer, the officer may detain the person for a reasonable period while the officer inquires about the suspected commission of the offence.

If the Commissioner or an authorized officer has reasonable grounds for suspecting that a person has committed an offence under section 7, 12 or 22, the Commissioner or officer may, without warrant and if necessary by using reasonable force, remove the person from the Terminal Area or a restricted area.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer who is a law enforcement officer has reasonable grounds for suspecting that a person has committed an offence under section 12 or 22, the officer may exercise any or all of the following powers, without warrant and if necessary by using reasonable force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: arrest the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: seize, remove or detain anything that the officer reasonably suspects to be relevant to the suspected commission of the offence.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Offences relating to performance of functions under this Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs the Commissioner or an authorized officer in the performance of a function under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: falsely pretends to be a person acting under the authorization or delegation by the Commissioner under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Commissioner may approve vessels as cruise ships
section.content: For the purposes of the definition of cruise ship in section 2, the Commissioner may approve a vessel not falling within paragraph (a) of that definition as a cruise ship.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1 or 2.

A notice under subsection (1) may contain incidental, consequential, supplemental, transitional or savings provisions that are necessary or expedient in consequence of an amendment made by the notice.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Public inspection of plans
section.content: The Commissioner must keep available at the Commissioner’s office, for public inspection free of charge during normal office hours, a copy of any plan deposited in that office under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings, a document purporting to be certified by the Commissioner as the Terminal Area plan or a plan of a permanent restricted area or non-permanent restricted area, or as a copy of such a plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is admissible in evidence on production without further proof; and

subparagraph.content: is presumed to be certified by the Commissioner; and
is evidence of the extent of the Terminal Area, permanent restricted area or non-permanent restricted area, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings, a document purporting to be certified by the Commissioner as a notice under section 10(1), or as a copy of such a notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is admissible in evidence on production without further proof; and

subparagraph.content: is presumed to be certified by the Commissioner; and
is evidence of the declaration made by that notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Terminal Area plan (郵輪碼頭區圖則) has the meaning given by section 3 of Schedule 1.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Saving
section.leadIn: This Ordinance does not restrict, derogate from or otherwise interfere with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a function under any law of a person in the service of the Government; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s performance of the function.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Subject to section 2 of this Schedule, the Terminal Area comprises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the area of land within the boundaries delineated and shown edged red in the Terminal Area plan, including—

subparagraph.content: the terminal building;
the apron; and
any structure or erection below, or annexed or attached to, the apron; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the area of water within the boundaries delineated and shown hatched black in the Terminal Area plan.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Terminal Area does not include the Kai Tak Cruise Terminal Park (set aside under section 106 of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132) for use as a public pleasure ground) on the roof top of the terminal building.

section.name: s3
section.def: Terminal Area plan (郵輪碼頭區圖則) means a plan—(a)titled “Location Plan of the Terminal Area” numbered KM9344;(b)signed by the Commissioner on 11 June 2015; and(c)deposited in the Commissioner’s office.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: pass holder (通行證持有人), in relation to a pass, means the person to whom the pass is issued.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may issue a pass for a restricted area to a person if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: because of the nature of the person’s occupation or employment—

subparagraph.content: the person requires immediate access to the restricted area; or
the person requires frequent and regular access to the restricted area; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is not, for any reason relating to the operation or security of the Terminal, unfit to have access to the restricted area.

subsection.content: A pass may be issued subject to any conditions specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: A pass—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the form specified by the Commissioner; and

subparagraph.content: the name of the pass holder;
its period of validity;
the restricted area for which it is issued; and
any conditions subject to which it is issued.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Validity of passes
section.leadIn: A pass ceases to be valid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the expiry of the period of validity indicated on it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on its cancellation under section 4(1) of this Schedule; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: when the pass holder ceases to be employed by the person who was his or her employer when the pass was issued.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may cancel a pass if it appears to the Commissioner that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the pass holder no longer requires immediate access, or frequent and regular access, to the restricted area concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the pass holder is, for any reason relating to the operation or security of the Terminal, unfit to have access to the restricted area concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a condition subject to which the pass was issued has been contravened;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the pass holder, or his or her employer, has contravened this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the pass has been lost, destroyed or defaced.

subsection.leadIn: If a pass is cancelled, the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must notify the pass holder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, if considered necessary, notify the employer of the pass holder.

subsection.content: Unless the pass is lost or destroyed, a pass holder, on receiving a notice under subsection (2), must surrender, as soon as practicable, the pass to the Commissioner.

A pass holder who ceases to be employed by the person who was his or her employer when the pass was issued must surrender, immediately after the cessation of the employment, the pass to the Commissioner.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.
